title: AEME Inputs
text: Inputs AEME designed similar standard data inputs used lake ecosystem modelling.

title: Getting started
text: first step define lake data. includes location lake, depth area lake, elevation lake.
code: # Define the location of the lake lat <- -36.8898 lon <- 174.46898 # View the location of the lake in a map library(leaflet) leaflet() |>    addTiles() |>    addMarkers(lng = lon, lat = lat, popup = "Wainamu Lake")

title: Getting started
text: depth area lake required model. can obtained variety sources, including regional councils, New Zealand Hydrological Database, lake owner.
code: # Set depth & area depth <- 13.07 # Depth of the lake in metres area <- 152343 # Area of the lake in m2

title: Getting started
text: Elevation data can acquired New Zealand digital elevation model hosted LINZ Data Service. wrapper function aemetools package. requires API key LINZ. can easily create LINZ website: https://data.linz.govt.nz/ use function within aemetools package create one. adding .Renviron file. get_dem_value function return elevation lake metres sea level. now create list lake data. used construct AEME object.
code: aemetools::create_linz_key() # Add the LINZ API key to your .Renviron file aemetools::add_linz_key(key = "your_key_here") # Get the elevation of the lake elevation <- aemetools::get_dem_value(lat = lat, lon = lon) elevation # in metres above sea level #> [1] 29 # Define lake list lake = list(     name = "Wainamu",     id = 45819,     latitude = lat,     longitude = lon,     elevation = elevation,     depth = depth,     area = area   )

title: Getting started
text: time data required model. includes start stop times model run.
code: # Define start and stop times start <- "2020-08-01 00:00:00" stop <- "2021-06-30 00:00:00"  time <- list(     start = start,     stop = stop   )

title: Getting started
text: hypsograph data lake, can use input model. critical input model, defines relationship lake area lake elevation. However, hypsograph data, model use simple cone-shaped hypsograph based lake depth area.  can see, hypsograph simple cone shape. Ideally, detailed hypsograph data lake, work example.
code: # Generate a simple hypsograph hypsograph <- data.frame(area = c(0, 152343),                           elev = c(elevation - depth, elevation)) hypsograph #>     area  elev #> 1      0 15.93 #> 2 152343 29.00 # Plot the hypsograph plot(hypsograph$area, hypsograph$elev, type = "l", xlab = "Area (m2)",       ylab = "Elevation (m)") # Define input list input = list(     init_depth = depth,     hypsograph = hypsograph,     meteo = met,     use_lw = TRUE,     Kw = Kw   )

title: Getting started
text: aeme_constructor function take input data construct AEME object. minimum inputs lake, time, input data.
code: # Construct AEME object aeme <- aeme_constructor(lake = lake,                           time = time,                          input = input) #> Time step missing. Setting time step to 3600 seconds. #> Spin up for models missing. Setting spin up to 2 for all models.

title: Getting started
text: AEME object can inspected printing console. show inputs use construct object along default values inputs provided. configuration section output, “Physical” “Biogeochemical” model labelle “Absent”. model configurations built. done next step.

title: Getting started
text: build_ensemble function take AEME object model controls build ensemble. model argument character vector models include ensemble. models available dy_cd, glm_aed, gotm_wet. default, build_ensemble function build file configuration model. create necessary files model run. files also stored aeme object configuration slot list hydrodynamic ecosystem model configurations. information data needed run ensemble models now contained within aeme object. allows easy storage data also easy sharing data others. Sharing aeme object others allows run ensemble models without needing reconstruct object.

title: Getting started
text: Saving aeme object file can done using saveRDS function. save object file .rds.

title: Introduction to AEME
text: AEME package hosts three one-dimensional hydrodynamic models: DYnamic REservoir Simulation Model (DYRESM), General Lake Model (GLM), General Ocean Turbulence Model (GOTM, adapted closed basins application lakes reservoirs). models can coupled corresponding water quality models, DYRESM-CAEDYM (Computational Aquatic Ecosystem Dynamics Model), GLM-AED2 (Aquatic Ecosystem Dynamics Model 2), GOTM-WET (Water Ecosystem Tool). Key aspects AEME package include: Defined S4 class aeme objects Configuration models common standardised inputs Standardised calibration, manipulation visualisation

title: Introduction to AEME
text: aeme object main object AEME package. S4 class contains information required run model. aeme object contains following slots: lake - list object containing information lake (name, id, latitude, longitude, elevation, shape, depth, area) time - list object containing information time (start, stop, time_step, spin_up) configuration - list object containing information configuration (dy_cd, glm_aed, gotm_wet) observations - list object containing information observations (lake, level) inputs - list object containing information inputs () inflows - list object containing information inflows (data, factor) outflows - list object containing information outflows (data, factor, lvl) water_balance - list object containing information water balance configuration (method, use, data) outputs - list object containing information outputs ()

title: Introduction to AEME
text: lake slot contains information lake. list object contains following objects: name - Name lake (character). id - Lake ID (character numeric). latitude - Latitude lake (numeric). provided, latitude calculated centroid shape. longitude - Longitude lake (numeric). provided, longitude calculated centroid shape. elevation - Elevation lake (numeric). shape - Shape lake (sf object). shape lake can represented polygon. centroid polygon used calculate latitude longitude lake. depth - Max depth lake (m) (numeric). Depth area used generate simple hypsographic curve none provided inputs slot. area - Surface area lake (m2) (numeric) Objects bold required building running model.

title: Introduction to AEME
text: time slot contains information time. list object contains following objects: start - Start date simulation (character). start date must format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. end - End date simulation (character). end date must format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. timestep - Timestep simulation (numeric). timestep must seconds. spin_up - List spin periods simulation model (numeric). spin period must days. spin period period time model run simulation period. spin period used initialise model discarded examining simulation period.

title: Introduction to AEME
text: configuration slot list contains model configurations. includes configurations files hydrodynamic components well aquatic ecosystem model components: Files hydrodynamic ecosystem models.

title: Introduction to AEME
text: observations slot list contains observations -lake (lake) variables (e.g. water temperature, chlorophyll-, dissolved oxygen etc.) water level (level). observations used assess model performance also calibrate model using aemetools package. lake observations stored data frame following columns: Date - Date observation (character). date must format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. depth - Depth observation (m) (numeric). depth must metres. var - Variable name observation (character). variable names input preparation designed AEME inputs article. value - Value observation (numeric). level observations stored data frame following columns: Date - Date observation (character). date must format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. value - Value observation (numeric).

title: Introduction to AEME
text: aeme object can created YAML file using yaml_to_aeme function. YAML file contains information required run model.

title: Introduction to AEME

title: Aquatic Ecosystem Model Ensemble
text: Aquatic Ecosystem Model Ensemble (AEME) package allows setup run ensemble aquatic ecosystem models. models DYRESM-CAEDYM, GLM-AED GOTM-WET.

title: Aquatic Ecosystem Model Ensemble
text: can install development version AEME GitHub :

title: Aquatic Ecosystem Model Ensemble
text: basic example shows build run one models ensemble: model input output (/O) handled ’s S4 object class aeme. allows standardisation generalisation functions class alongside ensuring integrity validity ’s structure. allows easier handling model output data within structure allows condensed output printed console: Model data can visualised easily using plot_output() function Also, visualising lake level plots.
code: library(AEME) #>  #> Attaching package: 'AEME' #> The following object is masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     time ## basic example code tmpdir <- tempdir() aeme_dir <- title: aeme Class — aeme
text: class represents data related lake running AEME. Items bold required run models.

title: aeme Class — aeme
text: lake list representing lake information. name: character; lake name. id: character; lake identifier. latitude: numeric; lake latitude. longitude: numeric; lake longitude. elevation: numeric; lake elevation. shape: sf; lake shape. depth: numeric; lake depth. area: numeric; lake area. Calculated shape provided. time list representing time information. start: character; start date. stop: character; end date. timestep: numeric; time step. spin_up: list; spin information model configuration list representing model's configuration. model_controls: dataframe; Model controls simulation. dy_cd: list; DYRESM-CAEDYM configuration. glm_aed: list; GLM-AED configuration. gotm_wet: list; GOTM-WET configuration. observations list representing observation information. lake: dataframe; lake observations. level: dataframe; lake level observations. input list representing input information. init_profile: dataframe; initial temperature profile (none use NULL leave empty; empty/NULL, observations file used). init_depth: numeric; initial height lake surface relative bottom (m). hypsograph: dataframe; hypsograph. meteo: dataframe; meteorological data. use_lw: logical; use longwave radiation. Kw: numeric; light extinction coefficient (m-1). inflows list representing inflows information. data: named list inflow dataframes. factor: named list; inflow factors model. outflows list representing outflows information. data: named list outflow dataframes. factor: named list; outflow factors model. lvl: numeric; height lake level outflow. water_balance list representing water balance information. method: integer; Method calculating water balance. 1 = none, 2 = outflows, 3 = inflows outflows. use: character; Can 'obs' 'mod'. Use observations  modelled data water balance. data: list dataframe water balance. output list representing output information. dy_cd: list; DYRESM-CAEDYM output. glm_aed: list; GLM-AED output. gotm_wet: list; GOTM-WET output.

code: build_ensemble(   aeme = NULL,   config = NULL,   model = c("dy_cd", "glm_aed", "gotm_wet"),   model_controls,   inf_factor = c(glm_aed = 1, dy_cd = 1, gotm_wet = 1),   outf_factor = c(glm_aed = 1, dy_cd = 1, gotm_wet = 1),   ext_elev = 0,   use_bgc = FALSE,   calc_wbal = TRUE,   calc_wlev = TRUE,   use_aeme = FALSE,   coeffs = NULL,   hum_type = 3,   est_swr_hr = TRUE,   path = "." )

title: Build model configuration directories — build_ensemble
text: aeme aeme; data object. config list; loaded via `config <- yaml::read_yaml("aeme.yaml")` model vector; models used. Can `dy_cd`, `glm_aed`, `gotm_wet`. model_controls dataframe; configuration loaded "model_controls.csv". inf_factor vector; containing numeric factor multiple inflows. Needs named according model. outf_factor vector; containing numeric factor multiple outflows. Needs named according model. ext_elev numeric; extension elevation hypsogrph metres. Defaults 1. use_bgc logical; switch use biogeochemical model. calc_wbal logical; calculate water balance. calc_wlev logical; calculate water level. use_aeme logical; use AEME object generate model confiuration files. coeffs numeric vector length two; used estimate surface water temperature estimating evaporation. Defaults NULL. water temperature observations included `aeme` object, use build linear relationship air temperature water temperature. Otherwise. uses simple estimation  \(temp_water = 5 + 0.75 * temp_air\) Stefan & Preud'homme, 2007:  www.doi.org/10.1111/j.1752-1688.1993.tb01502.x hum_type numeric; GOTM humidity metric [1=relative humidity ( 2=wet-bulb temperature, 3=dew point temperature, 4=specific humidity (kg/kg)] Default = 3. est_swr_hr logical; estimate hourly shortwave radiation daily values. Default = TRUE. path filepath; input files located relative `config`.

title: Plot AEME output — plot_output
code: if (FALSE) {   tmpdir <- tempdir()   aeme_dir <- system.file("extdata/lake/", package = "AEME")   # Copy files from package into tempdir   file.copy(aeme_dir, tmpdir, recursive = TRUE)   path <- file.path(tmpdir, "lake")   aeme <- yaml_to_aeme(path = path, "aeme.yaml")   model_controls <- get_model_controls()   inf_factor = c("dy_cd" = 1, "glm_aed" = 1, "gotm_wet" = 1)   outf_factor = c("dy_cd" = 1, "glm_aed" = 1, "gotm_wet" = 1)   #'   model <- c("glm_aed", "gotm_wet")   build_ensemble(path = path, aeme = aeme, model = model,                  model_controls = model_controls, inf_factor = inf_factor, ext_elev = 5,                  use_bgc = TRUE)   run_aeme(aeme = aeme, model = model, verbose = FALSE, path = path,            parallel = TRUE)    aeme <- load_output(model = model, aeme = aeme, path = path,                            model_controls = model_controls, parallel = TRUE)    p1 <- plot_output(aeme = aeme, model = model,                     var_sim = "HYD_temp", level = TRUE,                     print_plots = FALSE, var_lims = c(0, 30),                     ylim = c(0, 16))   p1[[1]]    p2 <- plot_output(aeme = aeme, model = model,                     var_sim = "LKE_evpvol", print_plots = TRUE,                     ylim = c(0, 0.02)) }

title: Run aquatic model ensemble — run_aeme
text: aeme aeme; data object. model vector; models used. Can `dy_cd`, `glm_aed`, `gotm_wet`. return logical; return model output within `aeme` object? Defaults TRUE. model_controls dataframe; configuration loaded "model_controls.csv". nlev numeric; number levels return model output. NULL, calculates number levels based lake depth provided within hypsograph. lake less thatn 3m deep, outputs every 0.1m, else greater 3m, outputs every 0.33m. Defaults NULL. verbose logical; print model output console. Defaults FALSE. debug logical; write debug log (DYRESM). Defaults FALSE. timeout timeout seconds, ignored 0.  limit     elapsed time running command separate process.   Fractions     seconds ignored. parallel logical; run models parallel. Defaults FALSE. ncores integer; number cores use parallelization. Defaults `min(c(detectCores() - 1, length(model)))`. check_output logical; check model output running? Defaults FALSE. path filepath; input files located relative `config`.

title: Run aquatic model ensemble — run_aeme
code: if (FALSE) { tmpdir <- tempdir() aeme_dir <- system.file("extdata/lake/", package = "AEME") # Copy files from package into tempdir file.copy(aeme_dir, tmpdir, recursive = TRUE) path <- file.path(tmpdir, "lake") aeme <- yaml_to_aeme(path = path, "aeme.yaml") model_controls <- get_model_controls() inf_factor = c("glm_aed" = 1) outf_factor = c("glm_aed" = 1) model <- c("glm_aed") build_ensemble(path = path, aeme = aeme, model = model,                model_controls = model_controls, inf_factor = inf_factor, ext_elev = 5,                use_bgc = TRUE) run_aeme(aeme = aeme, model = model, verbose = TRUE, path = path,           return = FALSE) }
